keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.print_headline: U.S. Consumer Bureau Proposes End to Arbitration-Only Credit Clause
headline.main: Protection Bureau Seeks End to Arbitration-Only Clauses in Consumer Contracts

byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and MICHAEL CORKERY

snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is to propose rules to stop companies from barring customers from filing class-action suits as a condition of getting credit cards.
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will propose draft rules prohibiting financial companies from using arbitration clause, which bars customers from their services unless they agree to waive right to file or participate in class-action suit.
lead_paragraph: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is to propose rules to stop companies from barring customers from filing class-action suits as a condition of getting credit cards.
